text: Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Prophet ﷺ said, 'The two Rakah before the dawn Fajr prayer are better than this world and all it contains.'
Abu Hurairah reported that the Prophet ﷺ said: 'When the heat is severe, delay the prayer until it becomes cooler, for the severity of heat is from the raging of Hell.'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever misses the `Asr prayer intentionally, it is as if he lost his family and wealth.'
Abdullah bin Mughaffal (May Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet ﷺ said, 'Perform two Rak`ah before Maghrib prayer.'
Ibn Umar reported that the Prophet ﷺ said: 'Do not be negligent about the two Rak’ah before Fajr and the Witr prayer after Isha.'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'The key to Paradise is prayer; the key to prayer is wudu (purification).'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever prays the morning (Fajr) prayer, he is under the protection of Allah.'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Between a man and shirk and kufr (disbelief) is the abandonment of the prayer.'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever prays the two cool prayers (Asr and Fajr) will enter Paradise.'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'He who misses the Asr prayer, it is as if he has lost his family and wealth.'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'You will see your Lord just as you see the full moon. So try not to miss your prayers before sunrise and before sunset (i.e., Fajr and Asr).'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever prays Isha in congregation, it is as if he has prayed half the night.'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'The first thing for which a person will be brought to account on the Day of Resurrection is his prayer.'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever prays Fajr in congregation, it is as if he has spent the whole night in prayer.'
The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Pray as you have seen me praying.'
